alert.note: Alert for Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 5:11AM EST until January 10 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 17 inches and ice accumulations around a light glaze. * WHERE...Southern Coos County. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 7 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Significant snowfall and periods of heavy snowfall rates will combine with low visibility to create very dangerous driving conditions. Heavy, wet snow will cause weighted tree limbs of conifers and leafed trees, leading to snapped branches. Snow will change over to rain, with a period of sleet and/or freezing rain at transition which will cause slushy roads and further degrade driving conditions. Plan on delaying travel to allow time for road conditions to improve. The hazardous conditions will impact the Wednesday morning commute. Winds are expected to become strong and gusty as snow transitions to rain. The combination of fallen snow clinging to branches and power lines and increasing winds will likely lead to additional power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Significant snowfall accumulations are expected to be mainly at higher elevations and in the eastern half of the county.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
